EVOLUTIONARY.Definition: relating to evolution, the way in which plants and animals change

EVOLUTION.Definition: the idea that plants and animals change over long periods

REBEL.Definition: someone who is opposed to the current system

ENLIGHTENMENT.Definition: a period in the eighteenth century when many writers and scientists believed that science and knowledge, not religion, could improve people's lives

ADVOCATE.Definition: someone who believes in something is speaks publicly about it

FREETHINKERS.Definition: people who have their own opinions

ANAESTHETIC.Definition: a drug that means you cannot feel pain

TURNED OFF.Definition: if you are turned off something, you stop liking or enjoying it

WELL TRODDEN PATH.Definition: a path or journey that is done by lots of people

ANGLICAN.Definition: relating to the Church of England

BEETLES.Definition: small insects with a hard back

BEETLE.Definition: a small insect with a hard back

MORAL.Definition: the moral of a story is a practical lesson that the story teaches you

DESPITE.Definition: used to say that something happens even if something else could have prevented it

DISPROVE.Definition: prove that something is not true

CREATIONISM.Definition: the belief that God created the world as described in the Bible

NATURALIST.Definition: someone who studies plants and animals

LEAPT AT.Definition: if you leap at an opportunity, you take it immediately

SEASICKNESS.Definition: when you are sick because you are on a boat

NEGATE.Definition: cause something to have no effect, to not be true

EUREKA MOMENT.Definition: a moment where you realise something

TORTOISE.Definition: an animal with a hard, thick shell

BRANCH OFF.Definition: to start on a different path

GENES.Definition: the part of a cell that controls how it develops, what it looks like etc

HERETICAL.Definition: opposing the normal or prevailing belief

WORKING.Definition: if you have a working hypothesis about something, it is an idea that is enough to continue work on it

GRIEVING.Definition: feeling sad because something bad has happened, normally a death of someone you love

SCARLET FEVER.Definition: a deadly illness that affects children

THE PUBLIC EYE.Definition: if you are in the public eye, people know about you

MISLEADING.Definition: causing someone to believe something that isn't true

CREATIONISTS.Definition: people who believe that God created the universe as described in the Bible

ANCESTOR.Definition: someone who is related to you and lived a long time ago

REMARKABLY.Definition: in an unusual and special way

AMMONIA.Definition: a clear liquid with a strong smell

COMPOUNDS.Definition: chemicals containing two or more elements

DISSOLVED.Definition: (of a solid) to be absorbed in a liquid

PRIMORDIAL SOUP.Definition: the mixture of gases and liquids that existed before life on Earth

POPULAR DEMAND.Definition: if something exists by popular demand, it exists because people have asked for it
